dt.t: Civilians were {wi}commandeered{/wi} by the army and forced to fight.
The soldiers {wi}commandeered{/wi} civilian vehicles to help transport the injured.

dt: {bc}to take arbitrary or forcible possession of

dt.t: The city {wi}commandeered{/wi} 60 acres of the property by eminent domain for a new high school.

et: Afrikaans {it}kommandeer{/it}, from French {it}commander{/it} to command, from Old French {it}comander{/it}
shortdef: to compel to perform military service
to take arbitrary or forcible possession of
